isis.stitle: Recall 99513 - Air Brake S-cam Interference on Front Drive Axles (02064) and Installed on 4800 and 4900 Models

recall.subject: Air Brake S-cam Interference on Front Drive Axles (02064) and Installed on 4800 and 4900 Models

defect.para: There is interference between the air brake s-cam on Dana front drive axles (Navistar code 02064) on vehicles built 5/4/94 through 8/11/99. As the brake shoe lining wears, the s-cam rotation may be limited by the interfering knuckle stud. If the s-cam cannot rotate through its full range of motion, the braking force cannot be fully transmitted from the brake shoe linings to the brake drums. This interference condition may, without warning and under normal driving conditions, result in a longer stopping distance or a dragging brake condition. An increased stopping distance or a dragging brake could cause a vehicular accident, resulting in possible property damage, personal injury, or death.

Navistar will notify owners of this campaign on their vehicles. A listing of owner names and addresses has been furnished to the involved dealers to enable dealers to follow up with owners to have the vehicles corrected. You must limit the use of this listing to this campaign since the list may contain information obtained from state motor vehicle registration records and the use of such motor vehicle registration data for purposes other than this campaign is a violation of law in several states.

para.emph: Before performing the service, please read and understand the following instructions completely.

warning.para: To prevent serious eye injury, ALWAYS wear safe eye protection when you perform vehicle maintenance or service.

Block the wheels to prevent the vehicle from moving. Support the vehicle with safety stands. Do not work under a vehicle supported only by jacks. Jacks can slip or fall over resulting in serious personal injury or death.

svcprocinfo.para: Please read the following steps carefully before proceeding.

step1.para: Park unit on level ground, apply parking brake, and block rear tires.
Jack up front axle and set firmly on safety stands.
Remove the eight-drive flange retaining lock nuts from the left front wheel.
Remove the drive flange and shims from hub (keep shims with drive-flange).
Straighten locking tab on wheel bearing retaining nut lock washer.
Remove outer wheel bearing retaining nut.
Remove locking washer.
Remove inner wheel bearing retaining nut.
Remove the thrust washer, outer wheel bearing, and wheel and hub assembly.
Cover the spindle with a wet rag to protect it during grinding of stud end.

Locate the spindle-mounting stud closest to the brake S-Cam. Using a small grinder with a small abrasive pad or cut-off disk, grind down or cut off the stud end until there is approximately zero to one thread extending beyond the lock nut. Be careful not to nick any parts with the grinding disc and don't grind into the lock nut (see Figure 1 below).

Actuate the brakes to assure there is adequate clearance between the brake S-Cam and the spindle stud as the S-Cam passes over the stud. If the brake S-Cam travel isn't far enough to determine the clearance, the slack adjuster may need to be adjusted until the S-Cam passes over the stud to verify proper clearance.
Clean spindle of all debris and apply a light coat of oil to seal diameter area of spindle.
Replace wheel seal in hub.
Install wheel and hub back on the spindle.
Install outer wheel bearing, bearing thrust washer and wheel bearing inner retaining nut.
Adjust wheel bearings. See CTS-5000 Service Manual for proper wheel bearing adjusting procedure.
Install wheel bearing retaining nut-locking washer.
Install outer wheel bearing retaining nut and bend locking washer tabs over both the inner and outer nuts to hold them in position.
Install original drive flange shims and drive flange. Torque drive flange lock nuts to 64 - 70 ft. lbs. 85 - 93 N.m.
Perform the same repair to the spindle stud on the right front wheel.
Check front brake adjustment and adjust if necessary. See the CTS-5000 Service Manual for proper brake adjustment procedure.

partsinfo.para: Two replacement wheel seals (PN: 402856R91) are required for this repair.

entry.para: Pull front hubs/ wheels, cut off knuckle studs, replace wheel seals

responuscan.para:
Proceed immediately to make necessary correction to units in inventory. All inventory vehicles subject to this recall campaign must be corrected prior to sale, transfer or delivery.
If vehicles have been sold or transferred and you are in receipt of Customer Notification Letters and Authorization for Recall Service cards for those vehicles, transfer location or customer must be notified IMMEDIATELY from your dealer location.
Dealers must correct all vehicles subject to this campaign at no charge to the owner, regardless of mileage, age of vehicle, or ownership, from this time forward.

The National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act, as amended, provides that each vehicle that is subject to a vehicle recall campaign must be adequately repaired within a reasonable time after the owner has tendered it for repair. A failure to adequately repair within 60 days after a tender of a vehicle is prima facie evidence of failure to repair within a reasonable time. If the condition is not adequately repaired with 60 days, the owner may be entitled to replacement with an identical or reasonable equivalent vehicle at no charge, or to a refund of the purchase price less a reasonable allowance for depreciation.
However, consistent with the customer notification, dealers are expected to complete the repairs on the mutually agreed upon service date.

In order to avoid having to replace an owner's vehicle or refund the purchase price, every effort must be made to promptly schedule an appointment with each owner to repair their vehicle as soon as possible.

claims.para: Refer to Dealer Warranty Manual for procedures to conduct Recall Campaigns.

It is important that the Recall Coding be completed properly to assist in processing the warranty claim. Complete instructions will be found in the Warranty Manual, Section 7-1. Special attention should be given to Items 39 through 44.

responex.para: We ask for your full cooperation and follow-up to this important subject matter. If you have any questions, or need further assistance, please contact the Regional Service Manager at your regional office.
